comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The former Frances Gibson, an actress and singer who left her first husband, attorney Walter Bowne, to "run off" with Maj. Jordan Lawrence Mott III (1881-1931), who finally became her second husband in 1928, when he was free to marry again. www.northumpqua.org/river/mott.html

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT article of February 27, 1914, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F07E6DE163AE633A... indicates that the "running off" was early in 1912, to the Far East. By the date of the article, Bowne had divorced Frances, but Mott was still married. It seems likely that the picture was taken before she ran off with Mott. Interestingly, at roughly the same time, late February, 1914, was the day Bowne remarried. See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F05E4DE163AE633A... The NYT has her maiden name as Hewitt in some cases and Hewett in others, but it was definitely Hewett in Time Magazine, when her eventual marriage to Mott was reported. See www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,929048,00.html
